intro: Oreogrammitis fenicis, commonly known as the fen moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as fens and wet meadows. The plant has dark green, wiry stems with leafy shoots that are often curved and have a distinct, linear shape. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores when mature. Oreogrammitis fenicis plays an important ecological role in maintaining soil stability and moisture retention in its habitat.
